conclusion: As the lamp is raised straight upward, the rays that reach the ground become more vertical.
The more vertical the rays, the shorter the distance the rays have to travel horizontally before they hit the ground.
Every shadow slides inward, its centre drifts toward the point of contact of the object with the ground.
Every shadow becomes smaller because the projection cone narrows.
Apple's circular shadow will move closer to the point where the apple touches the table.
Apple's shadow diameter will decrease slightly; the shadow keeps its round shape.
Small flag/cloth is thin, rectangular, standing upright.
Flag's rectangular patch will slide toward the pole/foot of the flag.
Flag's shadow height shrinks noticeably; the outline stays wavy-rectangular but is overall smaller.
Glass cup is transparent, with thin rim.
Glass cup's faint ring-like shadow moves inward.
Glass cup's dark parts contract; the floor-brightening inside the ring becomes smaller and closer to the glass base.
Chicken drumstick is elongated and irregular.
Drumstick's shadow shifts toward the bone tip resting on the slab.
Drumstick's meaty oval part and thin bone projection shorten; the silhouette tightens around the contact area.

When the light source is raised vertically, every shadow slides inward toward the foot of its object and becomes proportionally smaller; their general shapes are preserved but each outline is a compacted version of what is seen with the lower light.
